instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01521: What is 820-01521? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.PP5V_G3S: What is PP5V_G3S? PP5V_G3S is a 5v power rail present when the system is in a G3S standby state.
definitions.CPU_VR_EN: What is CPU_VR_EN? CPU_VR_EN is an enable signal for CPU VCORE that is present when it is high. Signals with EN on the end enable whatever came before the EN if the signal is high. Signals with EN on the end enable whatever came before the EN if the signal is high. ALL_SYS_PWRGD, PM_RSMRST_L, PM_SLP_SUS_L, and PM_SLP_S3_L are necessary prerequisites for CPU_VR_EN to be present. .
definitions.CPUVR_PGOOD: What is CPUVR_PGOOD? CPU_VR_PGOOD Is a signal present when CPU_VR_EN is presenT. CPU_VR_PGOOD is a prerequisite along with ALL_SYS_PWRGD to create PM_S0_PGOOD and PM_PCH_PWROK and PM_PCH_SYS_PWROK which are necessary for the machine to turn on and boot..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  L8570 "melt down" of (<SIGNAL>PP5V_MAIN</SIGNAL> to screen) CPU power rails not turning on.  Pulls 0.17A "20v"
threads.message:
I was handed this machine with a replacement screen installed.   The original screen was cracked.

The L8570 melt down was so bad the trace is vaporized.   The <SIGNAL>PP5V_G3S</SIGNAL> line does show 5v.  I did not bother to replace L8570 just confirmed that <SIGNAL>PP5V_G3S</SIGNAL> was present.   The CPU VGT Phase 1 is never activated.  <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> "<SIGNAL>CPU_VR_EN</SIGNAL>" is present as well as "<SIGNAL>CPUVR_PGOOD</SIGNAL>".  As a result the CPU does not enable screen voltage.

There is no modulation signal from Pin 11 of <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> "<SIGNAL>CPUGT_FCCM</SIGNAL>" and the only CPU rail that is active is "CPU VCCSA"

Could I be looking at a <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> problem here?  I wanted to bounce my line of thought off the forum before I just start flowing parts off and on the board.  Seems to me a that a surge or damage to L8570 is a ways off from a <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> failure.  I think I am missing something here.   I don't have much experience with this LB.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  L8570 "melt down" of (<SIGNAL>PP5V_MAIN</SIGNAL> to screen) CPU power rails not turning on.  Pulls 0.17A "20v"
threads.message:
Intel graphics doesn't require power (VCCGT), unless high graphics load is detected.

CPU core (VCORE) must be present and you should detect some variation there in the first 10s, when the board really boots.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  L8570 "melt down" of (<SIGNAL>PP5V_MAIN</SIGNAL> to screen) CPU power rails not turning on.  Pulls 0.17A "20v"
threads.message:
CPU (VCORE) is not present and there is no modulation signal at <SIGNAL>CPUVCORE_FCM</SIGNAL> from <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>.  All of them are down but CPU VCCSA.
As I mentioned above the only CPU rail that is active is CPU VCCSA.

Now I know CPUGT is for the GPU.  :)
